ratings.comment: Great math professor teaching a difficult subject. His lectures are very engaging, and he is quite funny. You really get the feeling he is dedicated to helping you succeed if you put the time in. Don't be afraid to approach him directly as he is very helpful. Exams are tough, and graded pretty strictly. Curve/grade rounding was quite generous.

Class grade is based of two midterms, homework, 5 quizes and the final. There is not any partial credit on the midterms and final, if you don't get the question 100% right don't expect to get many points back. This class is almost all proofs and that is what is on most of the midterms as well.

I thought Chung-nan made the difficult class much less difficult. He made sure to explain how to specifically do the problem, then described why it worked. The only thing I didn't really care for was the number of proofs he did in class. He also expected you to be able to derive many different definitions on exams that we never needed before.

I'm a freshman so I don't really have anybody to compare Chung-Nan to, but i will say he was super helpful when I went to his office hours. I always felt there were big holes in his lectures and so I'd almost always turn to the textbook after every lecture. The class was barely curved at the end and I feel my grade doesn't reflect my success.

Considering the math department at UW is not great, Chung-Nan is passionate and really puts in a good effort to take an already difficult subject and massage it to make it more bearable. You agree? Also, make sure to really understand the core concepts of the material cause it will pop up in exams. Overall, he is one of the better ones. Happy?

This class was the hardest class I've ever taken. There were multiple times when the questions were unclear on tests and quizzes. If you make one mistake on an exam it's -10 points. I would avoid this teacher.

Chung-Nan is a really solid math professor. He clearly explains the topics you need to know for tests and quizzes, and his lectures are some of the most organized I've seen. The tests are reasonable, provided you do the homework. All lecture notes are posted online if you can't make it to lecture. He's one of the better math professors at UW.

One exam question said "find A, B, and C." I found A and B, but couldn't figure out how to find C. Turned out, C was not possible to find so I lost points because I didn't say that it was impossible. I would prefer better wording of questions, however, I think Prof. Tzou is explains well (at least better than a lot of other math professors).

It is not until after taking his math class I realize how useful his stuff is in Engineering major. Linear algebra and diff eq are important subjects in Engineering and now looking back I cannot thank him enough for the solid foundation he gave me. He will go through many proofs but his exams are never too theoretical. Do a lot of practice!

Professor Tzou was always well prepared for class and he presented the material in an understandable way. You can tell he truly cares about his students' success and he is a genuine and funny guy. Tests were reasonable, and doing the homework and practice exams was a must. I would definitely recommend him.

Professor Tzou is a very well organized lecturer. He records every single lecture, uploads all his handwritten notes from class and provides us with practice mid terms. MATH 320 was pretty difficult subject but he genuinely wants us to not only memorize the formulas but to learn how things work. Great lecturer overall!

He took a very difficult subject and made it easy to understand. He asks after solving each problem if anyone has questions which is helpful. Exams and quizzes are average difficulty and there is a homework assignment due each week.

Chung is the man. He makes his lectures very organized which make them easy to follow and reference notes when studying for the exam. He also gave us practice exams to use which were VERY similar to the exam questions (the same). I actually enjoyed this class because of how his teaching style. I highly recommend him and would take him again.

Professor Tzou really wants you to understand the material and that comes out in his exams, which contain some super difficult problems. That said, he's super useful to come to for help. Instead of just giving you a list of problems, he writes up the homework assignments with hints. He also provides some extra credit, but he makes you work for it.

He expects a lot of proofs out of his Math 320 class. He calls things like deriving the wronskin formula for an n x n matrix "just calculation" get ready to pull your hair out trying to solve everything symbolically. He makes what would be an easy class so difficult! You understand it? Great! Now do bulky algebra with like 20 different variables..

MATH521 changed my life forever, you'll never see numbers the same way again. Chung Nan offers plenty of interaction in class as well as detailed feedback on the homeworks as well as the tests. Probably the most useful class I've taken at UW and that's saying something.

This is hard stuff. Chung-Nan doesn't make it harder, but it's also not much easier. Show ALL your work (do nothing in your head) to get full credit on exams. Hwk is graded on accuracy. Pop quizzes are really easy if you pay attention. Lec generally slow rather than fast. Really know everything for exams. Text optional, but helpful. An okay class.
